STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 28, 2023
Aprille Lynn Sutton
Child & Family Services of Northwestern Michi
3785 Veterans Dr.
Traverse City, MI, 49684-4516
Re: License #: CB280201037
Special Investigation: 2023C0000412
Dear Ms. Sutton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 248-860-0787.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3317
enclosure

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207 Staff Responsibilities.
Section (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be directly
Description responsible for all of the following activities:
(a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-home care. Social
service workers shall work directly with the children, their families,
and other relevant individuals and be primarily responsible for the
development, implementation, and review of service plans for the
children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency failed to complete the court's 11/2/2022 order related
to exploring and establishing a way for an incarcerated
respondent father to have contact with his child who is Native
American. An exploration of a way for the father/child visitation to
occur and sharing of photos with this father was to occur by the
January 2023 court date.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant X
On 4/11/2023 I spoke with Complainant X by telephone.
Complainant X reported this case relates to a Native American
child, Child A whose father, Parent B is incarcerated. Complainant
X reported at a court hearing in November 2022, the court ordered
Child and Family Services of Northwestern Michigan (CFSNWM)
and to send photos of Child A to Parent B, and to establish a way
for Parent B to have contact with Child A by the next court date on
1/30/2023. Complainant X reported at the January 2023 court
hearing, the agency had not done what was ordered by the court;
and the agency had no reason as to why it had not complied.
Complainant X reported the worker did not contact Parent B at all
2

about this matter during the period of 11/2/2022 and 1/30/2023.
Additionally, that despite there being supervisory meetings with
the worker; this lack of follow through and compliance with the
court order was not caught by the agency. Complainant X
reported this was an egregious act even if it had not involved an
Indian child.
Chief Administrator 1
On 4/19/2023 I spoke with Chief Administrator (CA) 1 by
telephone about the allegations. CA 1 affirmed that the case in
question was with CFSNWM. I advised her that per my review of
the case in MISACWIS, it did not show contacts with the prison or
Parent B related parent/child visitations as alleged in the
complaint. Nor documentation that photos of Child A had been
provided to Parent B by the required due date. CA 1 reported she
knew there had been a problem, but she thought that the worker
had made attempts to contact the prison. She was not certain of
that but reported the situation has since been rectify.
Foster Care Worker (FCW)3
On 4/28/2023 I interviewed FCW 3 by telephone. FCW 3
acknowledged being the worker on the case for Child A and
Parent B. She also admitted the allegations were true. As to why
the actions as ordered by the court had not been completed prior
to the January 2023 court hearing, FCW 3 reported she could only
say it was due to being a new worker and poor communication
between she and her supervisor. She reported she was not sure
what she was to do, or how to go about doing it. She reported the
required actions have since been completed, and the matter is
resolved.
Document Review
A 11/2/2022 Court Order as provided by Complainant X which
showed what was ordered, as indicated in the complaint.
Child A’s MISACWIC case record, (inclusive of a 9/20/2022-
12/18/2022 and 12/19/2022-3/17/2023 Updated Service Plan)
which showed:
• Child A is a 1 ½ year old Native American child who
entered care on 8/28/2021.
• Child A is a temporary court ward. He was placed with
CFSNWM on 12/14/2021.
• FCW 3 was assigned to Child A’s case 10/21/2022.
• Aside from a 11/14/2022 social work contact showing a
contact from Parent B to FCW 3 related to a workbook
from a prior worker, and 12/30/2022 social work contact by
3

FCW of a December contact not occurring, no contacts
were documented to Parent B, or the correctional facility
he is incarcerated until 1/30/2023 and thereafter.
• No documentation of efforts by the FCW 3 or the agency
to explore/ establish parent/child visitation between Parent
B and Child A. Nor that the agency provided photos of
Child A to Parent B until after the fact.
• FCW 3 reached out to the correction facility on 1/30/2023.
• Photos were provided to Parent B of Child A later in
February 2023. A 2/27/2023 social work contact by FCW 3
inquired to Parent B whether he had received the photos
sent.
• A 3/14/2023 social work contact where FCW 3 reached
out to a prison representative by email to verify when video
visitation could be scheduled for Child A with Parent B.
Analysis Based on interviews and the documents reviewed, the evidence
supports the allegations, and a lack of direct work by the
agency/worker with the child, their family, and relevant individuals
related to implementation of the service plan.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptance corrective action plan, continuation of the agency’s
current licensing status is recommended.
April 28, 2023
______________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
